Name: Minimum Remove to Make Valid Parentheses
Answer: Stack - keep track of unmatching )'s index and print

Name: Binary Tree Vertical Order Traversal
Answer: BFS with col n print. DFS to give col, row numbers, heapq (col, row, val), map to group them by col + print.

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree III [Parent]
Answer: Variation, if parent is None, flip it to other head

Name: Intersection of Two Linked Lists
Answer: a+c+b = b+c+a

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree II [p/q might not exist]
Answer: If p/q exist return none or p or q. If it doesn't exisit -> recursive call and then check node is p or q. Record p/q isFound. Becauze if p is found it returns and q won't reach if its the subtree of p

Name: Buildings With an Ocean View
Answer: Go right to left. Track max

Name: Basic Calculator II
Answer: Track prev_int, prev_opt, curr_int. Accumulate */, prev_opt +-. Append + to s for easy for loop

Name: Nested List Weight Sum
Answer: BFS store depth n calc weighted sum - simple

Name: Random Pick with Weight
Answer: Store prefix sum - sorted array, binary search rand+totalsum

Name: Dot Product of Two Sparse Vectors
Answer: Store non zero indices of 2 arrays, 2 ptr n multiple matching indices

Name: Pow(x, n)
Answer: Binary exponent, use iteration x=1/x n=-1*n for -n. 2^15 -> 2.(4.4)^7. while n//2 != 0

Name: Simplify Path: Unix-style file system
Answer: Split by /, rev, skip++ for .., if legit skip-- or add. Note: trailing /

Name: Kth Largest Element in an Array
Answer: Counting sort too! Bounder heapq like topk. Quick select will give better avg complixity for higher worst case. By choosing pivot using median of median algo, worst case will come down to n. Probability (2^n/n!) - each iter gets exponentially low. Just make sure its not the largest or smallest element.
Complexity: nlogk, n, n^2, m. Space k, 1, m

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree [Simple]
Answer: return node if None or p or q. l and r => n else l or r.

Name: Custom Sort String
Answer: Counting sort. Simplify. Map of counter(s), order[c] * count(c) -> result. Del count(c) from dict to not re-add

Name: Minimum Add to Make Parentheses Valid
Answer: Easy just use a counter to track ( and match it with ), if openCounter < 1, minRequired++. Use counter since only one type of bracket, else use stack

Name: Shortest Path in Binary Matrix
Answer: BFS - Lattice Graph - A* for bonus. Queue (r,c,dist)

Name: Merge Intervals
Answer: Elegant technique to handle -1 index. sort n merge

Name: Sum Root to Leaf Numbers
Answer: Global var for result. Preorder(node, num=0), when node is None, res += num

Name: Find Peak Element
Answer: Binary search - see sol. if mid > mid+1 (peak) : r=mid else l=mid+1. mid and mid+1 are the candidates

Name: Binary Tree Right Side View
Answer: Queue (node + depth), print only right for each depth. if len(res) is depth actually

Name: K Closest Points to Origin [R-Quick select]
Answer: Topk, quickselect => swap instead of partition. Beautiful - read comments

Name: Group Shifted Strings
Answer: Group string with same char offsets (use modulo). (1, 1): ['abc', 'bcd', 'xyz']

Name: Convert Binary Search Tree to Sorted Doubly Linked List
Answer: Have a global var to track prev node, store the next bst node in that and move the ptr

Name: Continuous Subarray Sum (sub is a multiple of 2)
Answer: Mathemetricall (R1 - R2) is divisible by k then yes. prefixSum[i] % k == prefixSum[j] % k then return True. Store prefixSum % k,index in hashmap

Name: Subarray Sum Equals K
Answer: Store count of same prefix. if diff in dict, count += val

Name: Insert into a Sorted Circular Linked List
Answer: prev, curr pointer. Track head and tail and insert at the end if can't insert in middle. 3 cases (mid, end, uniform values)

Name: Next Permutation
Answer: Find first peak from right. Swap p-1 with slightly higher right to peak, reverse p to end. No way!

Name: Copy List with Random Pointer
Answer: 3 pass. Beautiful list weaving. Light weaver Shallan. Interleave new node, set randpointer, delete old nodes

Name: LRU Cache
Answer: OrderedDict().move_to_end, pop_item(False). Or use doubly linked list

Name: Binary Search Tree Iterator
Answer: Iter requires pause + resume. So we need to simulate func recursion. Push all left subtree into stack on init(). Stack top is always the smallest. On next pop() and return but also push node.right's left subtree into stack.
Complexity: Amortized 1 time (each node is pushed/popped once. So 2n times. But next is called n times to remove so 2n/2 = 2), H space

Name: Top K Frequent Elements
Answer: Lomuto's Partition Scheme + Quick select on freq parallel array
Complexity: k=n-k for quick select since its largest k

Name: Diagonal Traverse
Answer: Simple traversal, care out of bounds. While r and c in bound

Name: Maximum Swap [Inverse of meta round 1]
Answer: Best!. Last swap all we need, r->l. Counting sort to keep last seen idx. Replace soFarMax elem with left small elem

Name: Interval List Intersections
Answer: 2 pts merge only intersections

Name: Number of Islands
Answer: For cell -> dfs. Regular

Name: Meeting Rooms II [Minimum meeting rooms req]
Answer: Sort by start time, end time in heap. Conflct? Push new end time, else pop + push new end time. len(heap) == num rooms

Name: Design Tic-Tac-Toe
Answer: O(1). Track num times a row/col/dig/anti_dig is filled by player. Win when times=n

Name: Random Pick Index [with duplicate values, so count determines prob]
Answer: dict(num, indicesList). d[target][rand.next(lenIndicesList)]

Name: Minesweeper
Answer: dfs

Name: Exclusive Time of Functions [function calls]
Answer: track prevTime, [exclusiveTimes]. if start: push, end: pop and exclusiveTime++, if double start: update exclusiveTime of curr and push

Name: Accounts Merge [Merge emails of a name]
Answer: Connected components + DFS. Or union find disjoinset (longer see sol). 2 dict (email->name, adjlist). Names can have duplicates
Complexity: nklognk time, nk space where k is length of acc

Name: All Nodes Distance K in Binary Tree
Answer: Convert tree to graph buildGraph(curr, parent) n run bfs

Name: Max Consecutive Ones III
Answer: Beautiful sliding window. k tracks 0s. Expand if k>0, contract n move if k<0. Regain k if left is 0

Name: Cutting Ribbons [Can u cut into k ribbons]
Answer: Range(0, maxRibbonLen) and binary search each length - check if possible by looping through all ribbons. Length is inversely prop to pieces
Complexity: nlogm time where m is maxRibbonLen, 1 space

Name: 3Sum [no dupilicates in sol]
Answer: Sort + 2 pts. For each i lo=i+1,hi=len-1. Skip conseq duplicates by lo+1. N^2 loop, check for complement is hashset.

Name: Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array
Answer: 2 binary search upperBound, lowerBound. if mid==target: check for mid-1 if lowerBound and check for mid+1 if upperBound.

Name: Count and Say [recursive call RLE]
Answer: Recursive call right after base (head recursion) and then return the RLE of curr.

Name: Subsets [All permutations power set]
Answer: Permutations - backtrack. Add curr to result, curr=curr+next backtrack(i+1)

Name: Clone Graph
Answer: Nice. BFS. Store clone in visited dict

Name: Word Break [dp/ trie]
Answer: Nice n easy dp. len(opt)=len(s) and each idx is T/F for each substring from start. For Trie, if curr idx is Trie word, mark as T in opt. Repeat the same for next i if dp[i-1] is T
Complexity: m*n*k time, n space. Trie with dp give m*n

Name: Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable [Matrix sum within submat]
Answer: Matrix cummulative sum. Sum(ABCD)=Sum(OD)−Sum(OB)−Sum(OC)+Sum(OA)

Name: Sparse Matrix Multiplication
Answer: compressMatrix[row] = (val, col) if val != 0. For each rowIdx of MatA  -> (val, colA) of compressMatA[rowA] -> for (val2, colB) of comMatB[colA] -> res[rowA][colB] += val1*val2

Name: Kth Smallest Element in a Sorted Matrix
Answer: Matrix binary search **. bottom left to top right.

Name: Find Largest Value in Each Tree Row
Answer: inorder(node, depth). res[depth] = max

Name: Construct Binary Tree from String [parenthesis string with neg nums]
Answer: if ( and num => push(num). if ) and num => assign num to top(left or right). if ) and not num pop and assign

Name: Add Bold Tag in String [group words to be bolded]
Answer: bool[] to track if each char is in word. for each word, start=0;star!=-1;start=s.find(w, start) => mark the indices as true. With that reconstruct
Complexity: O(m⋅(nk * (n-k))) time as find is nk * (n-k)

Name: Find K Closest Elements [to a target x]
Answer: Just find left [0, len-k]. if num[mid] is closer than num[mid+k] => move right else move left

Name: Max Area of Island
Answer: BFS

Name: Friends Of Appropriate Ages
Answer: Nice. Use counting sort because of the constraint. Init count[age]=1; res += countA*countB, if same age res -= countA

Name: Check Completeness of a Binary Tree
Answer: Bfs, each level isNullNodeFound? if found before a valid node return false

Name: Missing Element in Sorted Array
Answer: Nice binary search using offsets. Answer is left + k + offset num[0]. mid -> ceil not floor. right=mid-1, left=mid

Name: Remove All Adjacent Duplicates in String II
Answer: stack(char, count). Append if not match with prev, else ++top. Top==k pop. Build res from stack

Name: Angle Between Hands of a Clock
Answer: allHours*d - allMinutes*d. Convert minutes to hours /60. hours % 12

Name: Leftmost Column with at Least a One [row-sorted binary matrix binaryMatrix]
Answer: topRight to dig down. leftOn1, downOn0. Don't complicate while r<rows && col >= 0

Name: String to Integer (atoi)
Answer: Python doesn't have overflow, keep it simple use long.

Name: 3Sum Closest [3 ints closest to target]
Answer: Sort. Fix two numbers and use binary search to find the third number closest to the remaining target.Track the minimum absolute difference between the triplet sum and the target, updating the result accordingly
Complexity: n^2 logn time, logn to n space

Name: Letter Combinations of a Phone Number
Answer: Pop after backtrack. O(4^N * N). Space N
